extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups chopped tomato (1/2-inch pieces) or 1 (14.5-ounce) can diced fire-roasted tomatoes

extendedIngredients.name: chile pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon seeded and diced hot chile pepper

extendedIngredients.name: crunchy peanut butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup creamy or crunchy peanut butter

extendedIngredients.name: garlic cloves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 large garlic cloves, pressed or minced

extendedIngredients.name: roasted peanuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup roasted unsalted peanuts, for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: sea salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons sea salt, or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: tamari
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon wheat-free tamari or other soy sauce (optional)

recipes.title: African Peanut Soup

winePairing.pairingText: Pinotage, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for African. The best wine for African dishes will depend on the dish, but a fruity, aromatic white wine is a safe bet for spicy dishes while pinotage would be a traditional match for South African cuisine. The Pine Ridge Chenin Blanc - Viognier with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pine Ridge Chenin Blanc - Viognier
productMatches.description: The 2014 release of this intriguing blend delights the nose with a charming bouquet of enticing aromas of fresh Meyer lemon, fuzzy peach, ripe honeydew melon and yellow plum, mingled with touches of citrus blossom and white tea. The clean, vibrant palate enters with juicy pomelo, sweet lychee and honeyedtangerine fruits, balanced by vibrant acidity and hints of yellow apple and key lime pie that last through the crisp and refreshing finish.With its balanced acidity, this versatile wine pairs well with a number of dishes, from light salads to seafood to, most notably, foods with a hint of spiciness - its subtle sweetness provides balance alongside a touch of heat. Try Chenin Blanc + Viognier with a flavorful Thai curry, a sushi dish, such asa spicy tuna roll, or seared halibut. Blend: 80% Chenin Blanc, 20% Viognier

recipes.instructions: Place the vegetable stock in a 3-quart pot over medium-high heat. Add all the remaining ingredients, except the peanut butter, cilantro, and peanuts, and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.Remove about 1 cup of the liquid and place it into a small bowl. Add the peanut butter and stir until creamy. Return the mixture to the pot, stir well, and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.Add the cilantro, stir well, and garnish with peanuts before serving.

steps.step: Place the vegetable stock in a 3-quart pot over medium-high heat.
Add all the remaining ingredients, except the peanut butter, cilantro, and peanuts, and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove about 1 cup of the liquid and place it into a small bowl.
Add the peanut butter and stir until creamy. Return the mixture to the pot, stir well, and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the cilantro, stir well, and garnish with peanuts before serving.
